roleset.name: remove marks
roleset.note: ERASE-V NOTES: Many times the "agent" is properly felt to be a VP, but the VP itselfis not accessible as a constituent argument. In these cases you'llusually have to take the agent of the VP as the arg0 of 'erase.' (from erase.01-v)

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: He said that Oliver North of Iran-Contra notoriety thought he had erased his computer but that the information was later retrieved for congressional committees to read.

example.name: passive, with source
example.text: Moreover, he said, technology now exists for stealing corporate secrets after they-1've been ``erased *trace*-1'' from a computer's memory.

example.name: VP subject
example.text: Mr. Andersson says he is confident that [taking parts of the company public]-1 will help *trace*-1 erase the ``conglomerate stigma'' that has held down Trelleborg's share price.
example.arg: the ``conglomerate stigma'' that has held down Trelleborg's share price

example.name: all args
example.text: John erased the fat from the the expensive cut of beef with a chainsaw.
example.arg: from the the expensive cut of beef
